newsitem.title: USA: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Iomega busy on takeover talk.
newsitem.headline: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Iomega busy on takeover talk.

text.p: Buyers lined up for options, mostly calls, on Iomega Corp on Wednesday as the stock rallied on heavy trading.
Traders said takeover rumors were driving the options activity, but that no potential suitors or prices had emerged.
The New York Stock Exchange said it asked the company to issue a public statement to explain the recent runup in its stock price but the company declined.
"The company stated that its policy is not to comment on unusual market activity or rumors," the NYSE said.
Iomega shares ended up a point at 20-1/4 after climbing intraday to 21-1/2. Consolidated turnover topped 17.1 million shares. It was the most active issue on the NYSE.
The stock closed at 17-3/8 last Friday.
"There are just some rumors of a possible takeover but no names are floating out there," said a market maker in Iomega options at the Chicago Board Options Exchange.
Iomega options trade on all four U.S. options exchanges.
"Originally this morning they were buying everything," but action had settled down by midday, the market maker said.
The market maker in Chicago added that some investors had sold some call positions they had bought late last week.
"There's two-way trade on the 20s and they're still trying to buy the 22-1/2s," he added.
He said activity was centered on the June options, but that some investors were busy in the August series.
A trader at the Pacific Exchange said buyers of Iomega options were fairly busy on that exchange as well.
"I can't tell you if it has to do with unusual activity or the stock move," he said.
Whenever the underlying shares move above 20, he said, the options become busier "and that's what happened here."
At the CBOE, the Iomega June 20 call was most active, with turnover of about 6,740 contracts. The June 22-1/2 call traded about 1,750 and the August 20s traded 1,115.
Among puts, the most active was the June 20, which traded more than 1,600 contracts.
Most Iomega options traded on the American Stock Exchange, where about 8,620 of the June 20 calls changed hands, 4,600 of the June 22-1/2s and 3,480 of the July 22-1/2s.
The June 20 put traded 2,055.
The market maker in Chicago added that implied volatility in Iomega options had risen six to seven points since late last week.
"Volatility popped to about 65," he said. "It was down as low as 50 early last week."
